info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 2:58PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Stephens, Habersham, Rabun, southeastern Macon, southwestern Transylvania, southeastern Jackson and northwestern Oconee Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 258 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles west of Clayton to 8 miles northeast of Cleveland. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton, Clarkesville, Toccoa, Demorest, Highlands, Mountain City, Tiger, Dillard, Sky Valley and Cashiers. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northeastern Georgia...western North Carolina...and Upstate South Carolina.
